elements.title: Unity Dow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Botswana, writer Unity Dow (pictured) took legal actions as a plaintiff, legal counsellor, and judge to challenge gender discrimination and protect indigenous rights, before becoming a legislator?

elements.title: House Party (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the song "House Party" by Super Junior was praised by Tedros Adhanom, the director-general of the WHO?

elements.title: John Carter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Carter started his career as an early American colonial printer working as the apprentice of Benjamin Franklin?

elements.title: Berthellina edwardsii (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the sea slug Berthellina edwardsii secretes a white acidic fluid that is distasteful to fish?

elements.title: the new head coach (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the new head coach for Washington State Cougars football once played in a football game two weeks after an appendectomy?

elements.title: French ship Beaumont (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a wreck rediscovered in the former Royal Navy dockyard in Antigua in 2021 might be that of the French ship Beaumont, captured by the British in 1778?

elements.title: Margaret Louden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that surgeon Margaret Louden developed a treatment for people crushed by rubble during the The Blitz, but her contribution was forgotten until the 1990s?

elements.title: Hotel Macklowe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when a ban on developing the Hotel Macklowe was revoked two years early, some New York City Council members said they did not realize that they had voted to rescind the ban?
